definition: old variant of 趟[tang1]
classifier for times, round trips or rows/a time/a trip
to wade/to trample/to turn the soil
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
still/yet/to value/to esteem
surname Shang
to go on an errand for nothing/to go on a wild-goose chase
(fig.) to get involved in an unsavory enterprise
single trip
to make a journey for nothing
to go on a trip

sentences.english: The whole wardrobe door on the door, then the train made a beautiful articles.
sentences.chinese: 有门的整体衣柜，则在趟门上做起了美丽文章。

sentences.english: He went to the clinic to get some drugs for free.
sentences.chinese: 唐大爷去了趟卫生所，拿了些药，药是免费的。

sentences.english: He slumps to the ground a second time and stays down for more than a minute.
sentences.chinese: 他再一次摔倒在地，趟在地上一分多钟。

sentences.english: An open-topped bus ride became an essential part of the journey back from the Final.
sentences.chinese: 从归来的旅途中，趟篷大巴旅行成为重要部分。

sentences.english: Let the Ann to visit to England?
Germany doesn't want to be involved in the deadly hunt for the Taliban.
sentences.chinese: 所以，德国不想趟追杀塔利班这趟浑水。

sentences.english: As I arrived at the ford in the river, I pulled up my pant legs and prepared to cross.
sentences.chinese: 我来到河的浅滩处，挽起裤腿，预备趟过去。

sentences.english: He got up and waded downstream, his boots quickly soggy with water.
sentences.chinese: 他站起来，顺着小溪趟过去，靴子很快就湿透了。

sentences.english: I swim twenty laps every morning before work.
sentences.chinese: 我每天早上上班前都会在游泳池来回游二十趟。

sentences.english: But it is the spirit in a man, the breath of the Almighty, that gives him understanding.
sentences.chinese: 但在人里面有灵，全能者的气使趟有聪明。

sentences.english: You have a high fever and you're stuck in bed.
sentences.chinese: 你高烧了，趟在床上一动也不能动。

sentences.english: After a year, San Francisco called me home again. I missed it.
sentences.chinese: 搬家一年后，出于对家乡的想念，我回了趟旧金山。

sentences.english: Do not even trip to the toilet of the Crown Princess no freedom?
sentences.chinese: 本太子妃难道连去趟厕所也没有自由吗？

definition: (of trains etc) late/delayed/behind schedule/light dinner
(of a bus, train etc) to leave for/heading for
power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
(to go to) distant parts/faraway/a distant relative
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to go on a trip
outbound trip
train or coach service ("service" as in "they run 12 services per day between the two cities")
to take the car, bus, train etc
train/CL:列[lie4],節|节[jie2],班[ban1],趟[tang4]
(railway) train
regular bus (service)
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
return trip
to go back and forth/to go to and fro/round trip
surname Zuo
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
